intro: Pentace kunstleri, commonly known as the Kunstler's pentace, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
